plans.name: Tuesday Skills Practice
plans.notes: Focus on fundamentals and game situations. Emphasize communication throughout.

activities.name: Dynamic Warm-up
activities.description: Partner pepper drill focusing on controlled passing, setting, and hitting. Players work in pairs, starting with underhand passes, progressing to sets, then controlled hits back and forth.
activities.coachingTips: Emphasize proper footwork and communication. Keep movements controlled and purposeful.

activities.name: Triangle Passing Drill
activities.description: Three players form a triangle. One player tosses, second player passes to target (third player), target catches and becomes tosser. Rotate positions every 10 passes.
activities.coachingTips: Focus on platform angle, footwork to ball, and calling the ball. Watch for proper ready position.

activities.name: Setting Progression
activities.description: Start with wall sets (20 reps), progress to partner sets (focus on hand shape), then setting from various positions on court to targets.
activities.coachingTips: Hands should make a triangle/diamond shape. Follow through to target. Use legs, not just arms.

activities.name: Approach and Timing
activities.description: Work on 4-step approach without ball, then with tossed ball. Focus on left-right-left timing for right-handed hitters. Progress to setter feeding from various positions.
activities.coachingTips: Arm swing should be fast and whip-like. Watch for early jumping. Time the approach to the set.

activities.name: 6v6 Scrimmage
activities.description: Full court 6v6 gameplay. Rotate after every 5 points. Emphasize game-like intensity and communication. Coach can stop play to make teaching points.
activities.coachingTips: Encourage communication and teamwork. Focus on applying skills learned in practice.

activities.name: Team Cool-down and Stretch
activities.description: Light jogging, then static stretching focusing on shoulders, legs, and back. Hold each stretch for 20-30 seconds. Good time to review practice and preview next session.
activities.coachingTips: This is recovery time. Encourage players to stretch areas that feel tight.
